title.rendered: 10 Things You Must Know Before Moving to Los Angeles

content.rendered:
Los Angeles is the choice destination of many in California. The City of Angels is a melting pot of culture, attracting a diverse range of people from all over the world. It’s also the entertainment capital of the world, with Hollywood at its heart, and houses about 4 million people in total.

When you consider its good weather, scenery, and the numerous opportunities it offers, it’s easy to see why many dream of living in Los Angeles.

However, before moving to Los Angeles, there are a few things that you need to know about the city. Read on to explore ten key things about living in LA to help you make the most of your stay.

What’s it like to live in Los Angeles?

1. Pleasant weather

Most places have four different seasons. But in Los Angeles, it’s either the wet or dry season. The wet season runs from November to March and the dry season from April to October. August is the hottest month with an average high of 85 degrees. On the flip side, December is the coldest with an average overnight temperature of 48.

Because of the warm climate, it never snows in Los Angeles. Plus, there are plenty of sunny days to top up your tan at one of the amazing beaches in the area. What could be better?

2. Food and Nightlife

Talk about taking a culinary adventure. If you’re planning on living in LA, then prepare for some mouth-watering escapades in the many restaurants dotted throughout the city.

And it isn’t just the food. The nightlife too is great too! Expect lots of jazz clubs, brewhouses and cocktail bars – some of which are open until 2 am for late-night revellers.

3. Smog in the city center

As one of the busiest cities in the US, Los Angeles does suffer from air pollution. This smog is not unexpected given that the city is in a low basin and traffic is heavy due to it being an industrial hub. However, LA’s parks, hiking trails and other green spaces more than make up for the air pollution in the central business district.

4. Competitive job market

LA is highly industrialized. The ‘City of Angels’ boasts many industries in the healthcare, manufacturing, government, tourism, technology, and construction sectors. With 4 million people living in LA, the job market in Los Angeles is very competitive. But this also means you have a good chance of landing a well-paid job. Internships are another great way to get your foot in LA’s employment door.

Being an entertainment hub, the most popular jobs in the city are in the movie and entertainment industries. While these are tough to get into, nowhere has more opportunities than LA! Another industry that is fast rising and may be worth looking into, is technology. With more than 500 technology companies and start-ups within its borders, the city is fast becoming a global technology hub.

5. Traffic congestion

Driving around in LA can be difficult, especially because there are so many other people living and working in the city. But here’s the thing. You don’t need a car to get around! You can make use of public transportation to get to and from where you need to be. You can also take a bike, use a rideshare or take a walk – particularly if you live close to where you work.

6. Healthy lifestyle

Los Angeles takes health and wellness very seriously. The state of California now ranks 4th in the country for healthy blood pressure and 5th for the best average consumption of fruits and vegetables.

While living in LA, you’ll be spoilt for choice when it comes to new gyms and cool fitness programs. You’ll also find lots of green juices, avocado toast, and residents embracing a plant-based diet. Great for if you’re looking to keep fit and improve your lifestyle!

7. So much to see and do

Before moving to Los Angeles, you should know that you’ll never be bored on a weekend. With so much to do and so many places to go, you’re in for a fun time when living in LA. One of the best things to do in the city is to visit the magnificent tourist magnets that draw people from all over the world each year. If you’re just moving to the area, visiting these classic attractions is something you have to add to your to-do list!

8. Sports in LA

If you’re looking for a team to root for, LA will leave you spoilt for choice. From basketball to baseball, hockey, and more recently, soccer, there is a winning team you can cheer for in LA. The Los Angeles Sports & Entertainment Commission has been working to make LA a sports mecca. And they’ve perfected the work of the organization to secure and support high-profile sports and entertainment events all year round. You’ll definitely enjoy the sports and the electric atmosphere at sporting events if you’re living in LA.

9. Cultural Diversity

LA is a multicultural hub that attracts people from all over the globe. From dreamers to business people, you can expect to meet people from all kinds of backgrounds if you’re moving to Los Angeles. You’ll find a large Hispanic community in the city as well as Black, European and Asian communities too. Everyone’s welcome here!

10. High cost of living

Like the rest of California, Los Angeles is an expensive place to live due to the high demand for properties. In fact, data suggests the cost of living in Los Angeles is 43% higher than the national average.

With that said, it’s still cheaper than living in NYC and you can cut down on some of the cost too. Opt for one of the more affordable neighborhoods in LA or choose an apartment outside of the city center with lower rates. Alternatively, you could find a roommate to split the bills with before moving to Los Angeles.

Living in Los Angeles – The Bottom Line

If you do decide to move to Los Angeles, then congratulations are in order! Now all you need to do is find a great place to stay. To help you out, use the Roomi app to find your ideal neighborhood based on the amenities you need. You can also explore rooms for rent in the area, from entire apartments to shared spaces to keep costs down.

So, what are you waiting for? Give Roomi a try today and start your search for your dream home in LA!

Roomi is your one-stop option to list or find rooms, find roommates to settle into a new city easily. Download the app and sign up today!
